bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to James G. Blaine, August 12, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: DEPARTMENT OF STATE AUG 13 1890 RECEIVED.
Goldsboro, N. C. August 12th 1890. Mer. Ezek. E. SMith to the Department of State.
Monrovia
Subject: Instructions asked &c
Monrovia "Liberia" Iowa August 25, 1890
To the Secretary of State - or Acting Sec Wm F. Wharton
Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of the dispatch of the department of August 20, 1890 appersing me of my apointment as Minister Resident and Consul General at the United States at Monrovia Liberia.
In answer thereto I beg to express my acceptance of said appointment; agreeable to your request for
Monrovia
Goldburo, N. C. Aug. 25th 1890
Honorable James G. Blaine, Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: Having been informed that certain changes or statements respecting any politics have been filed at the Department at Washington; I therefore, most respectfully ask, that if such have been filed there that a copy of the same be sent to my address at this place.
I am, sir, yours very respec't.
E. E. Smith
Monrovia "Liberia" Iowa August 25, 1890
To the Secretary of State - or Acting Sec Wm F. Wharton
Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of the dispatch of the department of August 20, 1890 appersing me of my apointment as Minister Resident and Consul General at the United States at Monrovia Liberia.

In answer thereto I beg to express my acceptance of said appointment; agreeable to your request for such imformation I have to State that I was born in Washington County, Washington State of of Pennsylvania and am now a resident of Muscatrine City and County State of Iowa from which latter State I have been appointed I have never resided in Liberia or any of its dependencies; I have this day Remember and sowrn to the oath of office and beg to enclose the same with this dispatch I have also executed my official bond with the people sureties and have this day forwarded the same to Hon Walter
